description.narrative: Bahrain Institute for Political Development - Supporting Political Reform in Partnership with the Bahrain Institute for Political Development (BIPD)

A culture of democracy with popular understanding and appreciation of democratic values; enhanced practical knowledge of governance norms and standards, Human Rights and parliamentary strengthening to support the governance reform process.
Other General Services - support to civil society
democratic principles and notions in newspapers and public debates

comment.narrative: Lack of awareness and censuses on the ongoing national political reform.
- Completing phase 2 of the website revamp - Studying feasibility of e-library - Studying feasibility of Data Management System - Completing e-mail system upgrade - Developing content for the website

- Website revamp informative phase completed - Physical and virtual database center created with the acceptable security data protection measures - e-mail system implementation phase 2 completed - New content developed on: Gulf Forum, Contest of Political Speech, and the National Competition for the website - Document Management System procurement process started by IP

description.narrative: Enhancement of Negotiation, Application and Implementation of WTO, DDA, FTA and TPR outcomes - Ministry of Commerce & Industry

description.narrative: capital of a political entity

provider-org.narrative: Ministry of Industry and Commerce,Kingdom of Bahrain
Ministry of Industry and Commerce,Kingdom of Bahrain

description.narrative: Enhanced inter-ministrial coordination for Trade and Development and better consolidation of trade efforts

comment.narrative: Limited inter-minisetrial coordination in governmental efforts in the areas of Trade and Development

- Technical Advice on Bahrain’s obligations under different WTO agreements including Notifications, Tobacco Renegotiations, DDA and TPR issues. - Translation of the final version of the Trade Facilitation Agreement - Assessment and evaluation of Trade Facilitation Measures under Category B, and Category C of Bahraini FTA Measures, and TACB requirements. - Holding of Bahrain Export Development Forum and Seminars and dissemination of studies under the project - Finalization of the Trade Policy Support System - Arranging a mission of UNCTAD, ITC and UNDP Regional Programme for the development of a framework and policy options on trade issues and follow-up on the recommendations of the mission

description.narrative: Improved procedures under WTO TRIPS and WIPO agreements for IP systems of registration consistent with national objectives and international requirements instituted
independent political entity
Establishment of partnerships and engagement of stakeholders to formulate functioning Stakeholder Standing committee for Trade Implementation in Bahrain

comment.narrative: Limited role of stakeholder standing committee for Trade Implementation in Bahrain
- Preparation of Explanatory Memorandum for Patent Law and UPOV Law - Finalization of the Pricing Study for IP

description.narrative: Ministry of Social Development - Support to the Development of the National Childhood Strategy and the National Strategy for Persons with Disabilities for the Kingdom of Bahrain

title.narrative: National Childhood Strategy - Project Document- Extension
Terminal Evaluation of the National Strategies on Childhood, and Persons with Disabilities

description.narrative: National Childhood Strategy (NCS) for Bahrain is developed and finalized
independent political entity
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - policy, planning and administration
National Childhood Strategy is produced and approved by all line Ministries.

comment.narrative: National Childhood Strategy (NCS) for Bahrain is not available

-Develop a database of all stakeholders related to the areas of childhood, disability and elderly, and produce an analysis of the functions and roles that each stakeholder plays (policy making, service provision, advocacy, coordination, etc.) and identify relationships between them. - Conduct an assessment of existing mechanisms or plans (including the work done during the formulation of the three strategies) for the implementation of the three strategies. - Conduct a review of best international practices in the establishment and functioning of “research and analysis units” in the areas of child, disability, elderly and other social issues. - Identify and catalogue social services provided by the Government and NGOs in Bahrain and develop a Client Services Charter. - Develop a set of examples (two or three good examples) of the practice framework for the delivery of child, disability and elderly services in countries which have set high standards in social service delivery, and organize a workshop with the participation of MoSD, Centers and NGOs to discuss the practice framework used in Bahrain compared with the international examples.
-

- A full mapping exercise that links the strategies to the National government plan, as well as the SDGs, has been completed. - An assessment of existing mechanisms or plans (including the work done during the formulation of the three strategies) for the implementation of the three strategies has been conducted. - Stocktaking exercise for all NGOs, government, and Private institutions working on programmes, projects and initiatives related to childhood, disability and elderly in Bahrain has been completed. - Three examples of the practice framework for the delivery of child, disability and elderly services from Slovakia and the UK have been shared with senior management of MoSD, and a workshop with the participation of MoSD, Centers and NGOs to discuss the practice framework used in Bahrain compared with the international examples will be conducted during the first quarter of 2016. - A first draft of a database content of all stakeholders related to the areas of childhood, disability and elderly has been developed. - A review of best international practices in the establishment and functioning of “research and analysis units” in the areas of child, disability, elderly and other social issues has been conducted.

title.narrative: Capacity Development Facility Established at BIPA

description.narrative: Bahrain Institute for Public Administration (BIPA) - Establishing a Capacity Development Facility at BIPA in the Kingdom of Bahrain
Establishing Capacity Development Facility at Bahrain Institute for Public Administration in the Kindgom of Bahrain
capital of a political entity
policy, planning and administration
Specialized Capacity Development Unit (CDF) with clear manadate is in existence at BIPA.

comment.narrative: No specialized unit for Capacity Assessment/ Development and staff in the field at BIPA.

- Develop a research portfolio for BIPA that span all the research objectives and subsequent implementation. -Develop training materials for all signature services that have already been offered and/or developed by BIPA as part of its consulting offerings. - Plan and execute a research project for the development of a research agenda for Bahrain public administration and other Arab countries during the first quarter of 2015. -Develop the CSOM (Consulting Services Operational Manual) to include all necessary templates and processes to deliver BIPA consulting end to end. Extract and develop a training manual/material based on the CSOM to reach out to the public sector through a portfolio of trainings on BIPA consulting methodology. - conduct a preparatory meeting to develop research agenda for public administration research in the MENA Region. The aggregated results of the research will be presented at a dedicated session of the MENAPAR second conference due in October 2015. - Organize the Second Annual Conference of MENAPAR to facilitate exchange of knowledge and experiences among countries and partners in the Arab States in October 2015 in Tunisia. - conduct a final evaluation

- A research portfolio for BIPA that span all the research objectives and subsequent implementation was develop. - Training materials for all signature services that have already been offered and/or developed by BIPA as part of its consulting offerings were developed. - Research project for the development of a research agenda for Bahrain public administration and other Arab countries during the first quarter of 2015 were planned and executed. - Consulting Services Operational Manual (CSOM) to include all necessary templates and processes to deliver BIPA consulting end to end was developed. - The Second Annual Conference of MENAPAR to facilitate exchange of knowledge and experiences among countries and partners in the Arab States was organized in October 2015 in Tunisia. - A preparatory meeting to develop research agenda for public administration research in the MENA Region was developed. The aggregated results of the research was presented at a dedicated session of the MENAPAR second conference in October 2015.

title.narrative: Gender and Economic Policy Management Initiative - Arab

description.narrative: University of Bahrain - Gender and Economic Policy Management Initiative - Arab States
Gender and Economic Policy Management Initiative-Arab States
independent political entity
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Institutionalize the courses at the University of Bahrain (UOB) to produce a critical mass of Gender-aware economic policy makers and practitioners

comment.narrative: Insufficient capacity, procedures, tools and methodologies to promote and monitor progress towards the demand for incorporating Gender perspectives into national development frameworks
Finalize editing and design of the 12 modules. Hold Validation workshop and Training of Trainers (TOT) for the Policy Makers Course

In the first half of the year, editing and design of the modules were completed. Concept Note for the validation workshop was developed and TOT was planned. However, the activities were put on hold by the IP.

description.narrative: UNCT Workplan for 2014 & 2015
The UN in Bahrain contributes in a relevant and coordinated way to the development priorities of the country.
Establishment of Centre for Sustainable Energy

title.narrative: Project Document - 00089268 Bahrain Unit for Sustainable Energy

description.narrative: This project aims to enhance national capacity to manage energy efficiently and address current gaps in the energy sector.
policy, planning and administration
Energy Efficiency/ Renewable Energy Strategy/ Policy/ Action Plan in place with nationally adopted targets

comment.narrative: Currently the country does not have a coherent approach to address issues of sustainable energy; mainly energy efficiency and renewable energy. There is no National Energy Policy Paper; Energy Efficiency Strategy nor Renewable Energy Strategy. There are no national targets for energy efficiency or renewable energy.

- Development of year 1 work plan - Producing draft Unit organogram and staffing needs and TORs - Development of roadmap for National Energy Efficiency Action Plan (NEEAP) - Development of roadmap for National Renewable Energy Action Plan (NREAP)/ Nationally Appropriate Mitigation Actions (NAMAs) - Development of TORs for experts to lead on NEEAP and NREAP/ NAMAs

- 2015 Work Plan developed - Draft organogram and staffing of the unit prepared - Roadmaps for the NEEAP and NREAP developed and experts recruited. Inception workshop for NEEAP and NREAP held and stakeholder consultations started. - Updating of 2010 Gap Analysis started

title.narrative: Strengthening Capacity of Special Investigation Unit

description.narrative: This project aims to enhance capacity of the Special Investigation Unit (SIU) at the Public Prosecutor's Office to perform its role and assume its responsibilities in an efficient manner and according to international standards.

title.narrative: Capacity Building of the Special Investigation Unit of the Public Prosecution

description.narrative: Strengthening structure and capacity of the Public Prosecution to comply with the BICI recommendations & improving Case Management systems and Communication Plans at the SIU.
Justice, Law and Order - policy, planning and administration

1- Improved roles and responsibilities at SIU. 2- Case management System in place that provides real time information on case status and statistics 3- Internal and external communication and coordination enhanced

comment.narrative: • SIU established with basic structure and capacities • No database for SIU case management • No technical expertise available • No communication strategy

1- Develop a Concept Note to organize an Intl Conference on International Standards of the Criminal Investigations against Torture in November 204. 2- Plan a study tour for the SIU IT department on Case-Management database and automated functions. 3- Develop a training plan for the judicial police in cooperation with the British-Joint project with the SIU. 4- Review of the Case-Management data-base system developed by the SIU. 5- Assess procedures and capacities of the forensic lab. 6- Develop an Outreach and Media Strategy. 7- Awareness workshop on Istanbul Protocols for SIU partners working in the same field.

1- A detailed Concept Note was prepared in both Arabic and English for the planned Intl Conference on the International Standards of the Criminal Investigations against Torture. The Note included content of thematic areas for each session of the Conference along with the type of speakers and specialists and the required experience for the topics. It also included which Intl organizations to be invited for delivering speeches and the countries which have reputable experience and best practices to be presented at the Conference. The planned Conference was postponed to 2016. 2- A study-tour plan was developed for the IT specialist to visit UK to improve the existing technology platform at the SIU and the content of the case management system which is has been developed. The plan not only emphasizes on the management of the cases and information for organizational, statistical and administrative purposes, but also on reports to be published depicting the progress of the cases as well as cross-analysis of the information (intelligence). 3- A training plan was developed for the Judicial Police with hand-on practical training to be undertaken in Northern Ireland. The plan emphasizes on techniques and issues criminal investigations and gathering and use of scientific evidence including interview strategies, human rights of the defendants, cases and guarantees in which the interviews can be or must be audio/video recorded. Also the use of intelligence databases and its analysis in investigations and standards of cases of use and eventual abuse of force by police officers in demonstrations with peaceful and/or hostile demonstrators are also included. Emphasis is also being pit on ethic standards of Police forces and treatment and protection to be provided to victims, their families and witnesses. 4- The Case Management System that has been developed internally by the SIU IT specialist was reviewed by the SPA. Recommendations were on the provision of report producing functi
